I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

boardgame.name: Sack Stackers
boardgame.description:
It’s Christmas Eve, and every gift in Santa’s workshop has been carefully wrapped ready for delivery. You and your fellow Elves have been trusted to load up the sleigh, but the Sack Stacker 5000 is misbehaving! All of the presents are coming out in the wrong order and getting mixed up with lumps of coal... Can you sort out the gifts and make sure everyone gets what they hoped for on Christmas morning?

Sack Stackers is a festive, family-weight roll-and-write game that can be played solo or as a group; in person or remotely.

Use shared dice rolls to collect gifts, drop them into Santa’s sack and build patterns to earn points. You'll need to manipulate the dice, but beware of gathering coal that might interfere with your plans!

Simple rules, crunchy decisions and familiar gameplay akin to Tetris and Connect4 make this the ideal game for a family get-together.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mädjik Swört +0 (Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
user summary
Created for the fanzine contest held by System Matters in 2020, issue zero (+0) of Mädjik Swört contains material for Dungeon World, like a translation of Jason Cordovas labyrinth move and its adaptions by Logan Howard and Ray Otus, special items, and two Dungeon starters.

Also, it comes with a floppy disk of music.

German info from the creator
Material für DUNGEON WORLD
A5-Heft, 44 Seiten + 3,5“ Floppy Disk (1. Edition, 47 Exemplare)

INHALT:

- Intro – ein paar Zeilen zu Fanzines, Punk und wo Mädjik Swört herkommt
- Kollaboratives Umherirren – sich vom ‘Leiten’ lösen
- Der Labyrinth-Spielzug – flexible ortsbezogene Spielzüge
- Was für eine Maske? – fünf besondere Gegenstände zum Anlegen für Dungeon World
- Mädjik Messer I – vier spitze kleine Gegenstände für Dungeon World
- Mal mal ein Monster – Teil I einer kollaborativen Reihe – Monster für Dungeon World
- Dungeon Starter: Die Schatzkammern von Smaragdula
- Dungeon Starter: Im Zwischenreich
- Kerkergekrakel – zeichnerische Nebenprodukte des Rollenspielens
- Ausblick: Mädjik Swört +1
- Dungeon Synth Quest – Entschlüssle die verborgene Botschaft! (und gewinne!)
- Kid Ikarus: »The Mirroring Forrest« – eine Dungeon Synth Floppy Disk Singl

boardgame.name: Harry Potter: The Ultimate Movie Quiz
boardgame.description:
Amaze your family and friends with your knowledge about all eight movies, from Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone to Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2.

Your Hogwarts house determines which questions you will answer, so begin the game by declaring whether you are Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, Slytherin, or Gryffindor.

Spin the spinner and take the corresponding movie card. The player to your left reads aloud the question for your Hogwarts house and you have one minute to answer.

Correctly answer a card to keep it. If the spinner lands on a movie you’ve already won, you must still answer the question to get an extra spin. Collect a card from each movie to win.

Each of the 1600 question cards also displays the answer along with a short explanation about the topic. The aim is to be the first to collect a full set of 8 movie cards.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Baltimore Edition
boardgame.description: Now's your chance to take control of Baltimore as you buy, sell and trade the city's most prized properties in this classic Parker Brothers real estate trading game. With one roll of the dice you can own the Orioles, Obrycki's, the Babe Ruth Museum or the Preakness Celebration.

boardgame.name: Escape Box: Espion
boardgame.description:
Can you escape in time?

You have 60 minutes to solve the puzzles!

A mad scientist has sent a weapon capable of destroying entire cities into orbit. Trapped in the computer room of an underground base, you must find the code that will deactivate the dangerous satellite.

The countdown has started: the gun will fire in 60 minutes ...

This escape box contains:
. 1 32-page booklet with the rules of the game, the scenario and the solutions.
. 40 cards to hide everywhere.
. 1 60-minute soundtrack.
. 1 poster.

boardgame.name: Sjavs
boardgame.description:
Sjavs is a Danish and Faroese game in the Schafkopf family. Many variants exist but the predominant one in the Faroe Islands is a four player game and the predominant one in Denmark is a three player game. Variants exist for 1 and 2 players also. The game was brought back to Denmark from Germany by travelling journeymen (Navere) and evolved here mainly among craftsmen and very much became a pub game.

The Danish game is different in that it only has 20 cards and players start with 50 points each. The first to 0 loses. The most common variant is called Klørtjavs (Clubs Tjavs) where clubs is a fixed trump suit.

boardgame.name: Pays de Guérande et Saint-Nazaire: Le Jeu
boardgame.description:
Pays de Guérande et Saint-Nazaire is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography going from Guérande to Saint-Etienne-de-Montluc via Pontchateau, the Sillon de Bretagne, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the territory of Guérande, Saint-Nazaire...

boardgame.name: Take-out
boardgame.description:
Take-out is an exciting number game. Can you remove all the numbered dice for a score of zero? Take-out is fast to learn and fun to play.

Players each start with 50 points. If a player reaches 150 points they are eliminated. The game continues until there is only one player remaining.

Each turn a player will roll 10 red dice. Then they will roll two white dice. The total number of pips on the white dice must be removed from the pile of red cubes in any combination. The player continues to roll the white dice until they can no longer remove the red dice. If a player can remove all red dice, they subtract 10 from their total score. If unable to remove all red die they player will add the combination of remaining dice to their score.

Blanks can be used in place of any number, but if any remain at the end of the turn the player will be penalized 20 points.

boardgame.name: Hexagone
boardgame.description:
The aim of the game is to gain as many French regions as possible by answering questions.

The board is comprised of bottom side serving as a wheel indicator, and a top side representing the map of France in the shape of a hexagon.

On each turn, the player turns the HEXAGON board and rolls the dice; the number indicates on the board either a region, a Chance card, or a Question card.

On a "Region" space, the player wins it if he correctly gives his name; he then scores as many points as the number on the dice. He gains additional points if he gives the capital, the departments.

On the "Chance" boxes the player can gain or lose points then play again, can play with the islands (Corsica, DOM) and gain points in the same way as on a "Region" box.

On the "Questions" boxes, the player answers as many questions as there are points achieved by rolling the dice; each correct answer is worth as many points as those of the dice. Certain boxes allow the points obtained to be multiplied by 2. In addition, the possession of all departments of a region earns bonus points, as well as possession of regions of the same color.

The best total wins the game.

boardgame.name: Jeu de la Caisse d'épargne
boardgame.description:
The number of players is not limited in the big game "CAISSE D'EPARGNE" but we recommend a maximum of 5 people. (One of the players will have the title of Cashier and will be at the same time the agent of the Caisse d'Epargne, the real estate agent and the seller of household appliances).

—description from the back of the box (translated)

boardgame.name: La Belgique infernale
boardgame.description:
2000 questions for the transition to the 2000 year.
18000 classic questions on Belgium (geography, history, sciences, politics, gastronomy, sports, various facts, folklore, culture) and 200 infernal questions.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

boardgame.name: City of Dra'Zah-Pah
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dra'Zah-Pah [...] is an innovative and easy to use system for build-as-you-play fantasy city adventures.

[Y]ou do need Boggle...

Christus salvum anima vestra.

boardgame.name: Lunarian Defense Ships
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Starship Builder Kit has been designed to allow you to utilize various stylized starship sections to compile your very own custom starship deckplan. You can use any graphics editing software that support PNG format to combine the piec-es, drop them directly into your favorite virtual tabletop (VTT) application, or even print and cut them out to be put together to make a tabletop play map.
...
Herein you will find 20 ship sections including three sample ships built utilizing the included resources, 14 area sections, four hull sections, and a door and section connector section.

boardgame.name: Dec 12, 2020
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Lair of the Gazing Tyrant (12 Days of Map-Mas ~ Day #1 of 12)

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Sentient Slime
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A vile green light flickers in the distance towards the end of the winding stone tunnel where a wall has collapsed. The main door has been barred by the fallen debris but the collapsed wall luckily gives access to a ledge and balcony above an eerie lake of pulsating goo.

After turning a corner you find yourself in a large room that has partially collapsed, the floor is lined by large metal grates and below them a stream of viscous green liquid flows out towards the lake. At the far end of the room there is a still intact crescent basin of sorts, also full of this strange green substance.

Adventure Seed

A recluse scholar has sent you to take a sample of a mysterious, green substance beneath the ruins of an ancient city. You must collect it from the original source—a crescent basin, to which he has given you the coordinates based off old blueprints he has.

According to the scholar, the substance will enable him to create wonderful devices that will grow and harvest food, saving hundreds of thousands of lives. When you go to take the sample however, tendrils of the goop reach out towards you, dripping into quivering blobs...

What’s happening? A vanished civilization once sentenced criminals to death by dissolving them into a magical substance that flowed through infrastructure beneath their city. It used the energy of their souls to power wondrous technologies, making their city a bountiful marvel of the ancient world.

However, as crime dropped due to the horrific consequences, the city's rules became stricter and stricter, twisting around its inhabitants like a serpent. Eventually people were sentenced for small things like forgetting to bow to officials, or missing religious ceremonies.

Sick of living in fear, a mage rose up against the city whose technologies—designed to make lives easier—had begun to cannibalize its people. She spoke out against what was happening, but for it, her and her followers were sentenced to death.

Despite the agony of her fate, in her last moments she managed to merge her consciousness with the slime—bringing it to life, and destroying the machinery it powered. She couldn’t hold onto herself for long, however, for the magic she had wrought had partially recovered the minds of others lost to the substance.

Thus, the mage’s consciousness faded, and the slime took on a horrible sentience of its own.

boardgame.name: Abyssal Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beyond the pillared passage, a broken bridge crosses the deep pit and onto a central rocky platform where cold bellows up from the yawning abyss. Other small passage ways connect up to this large cavern and it’s shape is that as if it was carved by an ancient hand. Shadows reach from gloom below and an eerie feeling creeps over you while you remain here.

boardgame.name: Beach Foreshore
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rumble of waves can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a foreshore. White water swirls as the waves come in, covering rocks and fallen trees, ending with filling up rock pools. In the distance the blue ocean and cloudy sky are all you can see.

boardgame.name: River Styx
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rumble of fast flowing water can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a raging river. Glowing water swirls as it rushes pass, being deflected by large rocks within the river dragging the souls of the dead towards there final destination. On the other side of the stream a rocky ashland spans off into the distance.

boardgame.name: I Have the High Ground
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The bubbling of flowing magma can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a roiling stream of lava. Molten stone swirls as it rushes pass, being deflected by large rocks within the stream. On the other side of the stream a rocky ashland spans off into the distance.

boardgame.name: Crimson River Styx
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rumble of fast flowing water can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a raging river. Glowing water swirls as it rushes pass, being deflected by large rocks within the river dragging the souls of the dead towards there final destination. On the other side of the stream a rocky ashland spans off into the distance.

boardgame.name: Muddy River Crossing
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The trickle of flowing water can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a muddy ravine. The water below slowly meanders through the muddy creek bed and the smell of decaying plant matter wafts in the air. On the other side of the river a dreary forest spans off into the distance.

boardgame.name: River Rapids
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The rumble of fast flowing water can be heard ahead and after following the path through the gorge for a while you meet with a cliff-side path above a raging river. White water swirls as it rushes pass, being deflected by large rocks within the river and running under fallen trees. On the other side of the river a green fertile forest spans off into the distance.

boardgame.name: Herald of Doom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 531st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a crater in a road created by something seen as a divine herald of doom by the locales.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Oasis Between Rocks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 532nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small oasis hidden in between rock formations.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Sacrificial Pyramid
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 533rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a kind of pyramid serving as a sacrificial temple.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2160 pixels in size at 72dpi.

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #38
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility. This set contains:


Player and GM versions of two 100x200 foot geomorph tiles.
Player and GM versions of two 200x200 foot geomorph tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Endless Lands Quick Start Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Endless Lands are infinite and if something is not found right here, it exists elsewhere.

Endless Lands is a fantasy game with a simple six-sided dice system, where each resolution has highly influential consequences in fiction.

The main characters are unique and take high risks as they put their Paths and Relationships to the test. The system is made up of rules modules that you can customize to improve your experience. It has different ways of building the world and styles of play.

boardgame.name: Endless Lands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Endless Lands are infinite and if something is not found right here, it exists elsewhere.

Endless Lands is a fantasy game with a simple six-sided dice system, where each resolution has highly influential consequences in fiction.

The main characters are unique and take high risks as they put their Paths and Relationships to the test. The system is made up of rules modules that you can customize to improve your experience. It has different ways of building the world and styles of play.

boardgame.name: Geminoa
boardgame.description:
Two girls, one who supports the Heavens and the other the Demons, their souls eternally reincarnated. Over many lives and deaths, the two confront each other in that forgotten place. A battle beyond the boundary of human knowledge is about to take place once more.

Lives as songstresses. Lives as assassins. Through the memories of your past lives, you have learned to wield swords and summon powerful beasts. But the power of memories alone will not be enough to defeat the formidable opponent before you.

By eliminating the unnecessary memories and connecting together those that are more compatible, it is possible to bring these abilities to a much higher level. When you find a power you like, master it. Upon mastering it, you may continue to use it forever. Will you become a mighty master swordsman? Or perhaps master the power of flame as a great mage...?

Geminoa is a dueling card game for two players, with a twist on the usual deck builders: rather than start with a small deck and acquire new, powerful cards, players instead start with a large deck of 30 cards. As cards are played and discarded, it is possible to return a card from the discarded pile, optimizing your set of cards by discarding the those that do not align with your strategy and emphasizing those that do.

The game also includes rules for solo play, in which you will duel a strong enemy which varies its tactics every game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 50 Kinds of Kibble Prepack Foods - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kibble is a slang term for very cheap, very heavily produced food designed for the teeming masses in the dark future. Many national laws demand levels of protein, vitamins and minerals appear in this food, but to keep profits high and costs down, meat might be quietly substituted with simulations, insects, or pet meats. Vegetarian kibble relies heavily on simple vitamin additions and engineered organic molecules to simulate the far more expensive ground-grown vegetables that people in the 20th century used to grow on farms or in city gardens.

This list is designed for dark future adventure settings (like Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Rifts, etc.) where corporations are out there squeezing the poor for money and power. Designed to give the game master instant background details, this list also helps players understand why the poor need a revolution. NOTE: Items with a “*” have a chem tab to reheat the contents.

boardgame.name: 100 Horse Companions Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Horses provide a sense of primordial power and motion to the Wild West. So why not take the utmost advantage of that sensation in your Fantasy or Wild West game? The faithful steed is too often simply a pile of numbers, and has no real appearance, personality or spirit. We can and should do better than that.

This list is intended for any wild west, fantasy or modern setting where the land is vast, and fresh secrets can be discovered around every corner. Unlike the first volume, this set of horses does not intentionally try to represent which breeds are more common, and we’ve gone instead for variety. As always, this product works easily with all the other D10 Dimension products (particularly ones like 100 Horse Tricks, 100 Naughty Horse Behaviors, etc.).

boardgame.name: 100 Horse Companions Volume 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Horses provide a sense of primordial power and motion to the Wild West. So why not take the utmost advantage of that sensation in your Fantasy or Wild West game? The faithful steed is too often simply a pile of numbers, and has no real appearance, personality or spirit. We can and should do better than that.

This list is intended for any wild west, fantasy or modern setting where the land is vast, and fresh secrets can be discovered around every corner. Unlike the first volume, this set of horses does not intentionally try to represent which breeds are more common, and we’ve gone instead for variety. As always, this product works easily with all the other D10 Dimension products (particularly ones like 100 Horse Tricks, 100 Naughty Horse Behaviors, etc.).

boardgame.name: 200 Fantasy Familiars Land Animals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Familiars are small magic creatures that share a mystic bond with wizards, witches, sorcerers and other spell casters. Most of them take on the form of animals. And while many sword and sorcery games offer a meager selection of animals to choose from, the choices are rarely awe-inspiring.

This system-agnostic list is meant for any mystic campaign where wizards and wildlife are common. The animals that make up this list are interesting - don’t be shocked if you or players want to open up a search engine to see details on the real world animal that was rolled. You’ll also find that these animals are from across the world - there’s little need for the Game Master to develop imaginary creatures when incredible real animals already exist.

boardgame.name: 50 Prohibition Agents Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The urgent need for enforcing prohibition came to the men* hired on in droves to be prohibition agents. With inconsistent training, odd and diverse backgrounds and low pay, they were a strange brotherhood of new government agents that filled an urgent need, and would pave the way, in time, for the Federal Bureau of Investigations.

This system agnostic list of characters can be applied to any roleplaying game system set in the roaring 20’s. While these agents reflect the diversity of the open call for prohibition agents, they can be adapted easily for any government agents of the time. Rank, assigned equipment and vehicles are not included in this list, and we leave them up to Game Masters to assign as needed. *Note: All the characters in this list are male because historically there was only about one female in every 100 Prohibition Agents. We recommend the Game Master take the time to treat those rare female agents with care since they were often given missions that played to their unique strengths. If you’d like to see a list of female prohibition agents please let us know.

boardgame.name: 200 Fantasy Familiars Air Animals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Familiars are small magic creatures that share a mystic bond with wizards, witches, sorcerers and other spell casters. Most of them take on the form of animals. And while many sword and sorcery games offer a meager selection of animals to choose from (like a bat, raven, owl or hawk), why aren’t the parrots, flying foxes, giant butterflies, shrikes, flying squirrels, sugar gliders, or giant dragonflies offered?

This system-agnostic list is meant for any mystic campaign where wizards and wildlife are common. The animals that make up this list are interesting - don’t be surprised if players want to open up a search engine to see details on the real world animal that was rolled. You’ll also find that these animals are from across the world - there’s no need for a Game Master to develop imaginary creatures when incredible real animals already exist. NOTE: This list only applies to animals who are predominantly in the air. There is already a 200 Fantasy Familiars - Land Animals available, and you can expect to see an aquatic version of this list out in the near future.

boardgame.name: Falgoba
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This release of Planet on a Page features Falgoba, a hazy, toxin and sporing fungus filled planet that is scarred from the atomic fueled wars of a lost civilization. This planet is a place where weird mutant beasts roam through toadstool forests and treasure hunters brave the dangerous ruins in search of interesting relics to sell. If you think you can handle the mutants, spore clouds, radiation, and erratic energy storms then the world of Falgoba might just be the place for you.

So what's there on this big toxic fungus world for a group of space adventurers to do?

Start out in the north at Korik Station- where a romp of the relic filled ruins are just beyond the city walls. When you've had your fill of being a trinket trader head on to Qwalruho Forest where you can run into some floating venomous stinger urchins! Waste a few of these oddities and recover their tasty flesh or their intoxicating (and deadly) venom!

Want to uncover the still working technology left behind by the civilization that ruined this planet? You'll find it in the constructed passages deep within the caves of Rulemuzan Ridge! Just be on the look out for whip roots and acid spitting rodents!

boardgame.name: Zurkari
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This release of Planet on a Page features Zurkari, a cold, rocky planet prone to freezing storms of dust and ice as well as a gnawing depression that overwhelms its citizens (who are usually just above the poverty line). Though recognized as an industrial world with noted natural resources there are many things that the cities and outposts of Zurkari often lack (usually decent food), which in turn keeps their economy in check at below average.

So what's there on this chilly dirtball for a group of space adventurers to do? Try checking out the wreckage of an ancient alien vessel in the northern Balhaza wastes. Its full of all kinds of relics and ancient technology they say- just be sure to pack a laser rifle when you go because most of the locals (including scoundrels) frown on the presence of outsiders. If that's not risky enough you can always snoop in one the clandestine weapons manufacturers in the Valkarian Ice Fields region. Just be sure that the payoff is worth it!

Not much into recovering ancient relics or taking out laser cannon building criminals? Well, become a scoundrel yourself and sign up with one of the poacher camps in the Holcha Greenlands! The hungry citizens of Zurkari are always wanting a bit of fresh meat in their diet and so do the ravenous predators that provide a constant threat to the safari camps! If hunting is not your thing you can always find work (or bust someone out) at the newly built Halino Prison!

boardgame.name: Septox
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This release of Planet on a Page features Septox, a once promising world that has ended up becoming a galactic dump site. This planet features numerous different designated refuse areas as well as some other interesting localities- including dangerous criminal ones! Corruption is high here and most of the citizens are degenerates, exiles, outcasts, or just willing do to anything (and live anywhere) for steady pay!

So what's there on this big garbage heap for a group of space adventurers to do? Try prizing open one of the overgrown mutant bivalves in the Tenajulka Reef area- you might just find a big ol' pearl! More heroic missions your sort of thing? Then sign up to do a little spying on the good folks of Gelan Test Station... word has it that their rogue scientists are contributing to the ongoing mutation problem that is spreading across the planet's surface.

Are you a bit shady? Maybe you and your comrades are smuggers or space pirates? If this is the case then you'll definitely feel at home at Jelcheza Freedom Camp.

boardgame.name: Huralzo Karu
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This release of Planet on a Page features Huralzo Karu. Once a blistering desert world, Huralzo Karu is cooling into a lush planet that is undergoing a massive megabloom. On this world you will find extremes of poverty and wealth, enlightenment and shallow attitudes, a desire for discipline and rampant corruption. Despite many shortcomings Huralzo Karu is a thriving merchant stop for exotic spices, fragrances, and fine jewelry.

So what's there on this big pollen producing world for a group of space adventurers to do? Try getting access into a certain mountainous shrine where its believed that monks are hiding well paying fugitives... or perhaps into that secret garden where some believe mystical women grow flowers with potent intoxicating properties. Potent plants and wanted men not your thing? How about heading out to Balnashad Valley in search of the elusive kalijariuno tiger? You know every zoo this side of the galaxy wants one or two in their exhibits!

boardgame.name: Tyronaz
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So what's there on this big tropical, fang and claw filled world for a group of space adventurers to do? When you're not firing your laser blasters at something with fur or scales try exploring that prison ship crash site in the Olkashoa region. Some folks believe a notorious crime lord is still alive there and there's competing rewards for his return- one is from the prison authorities and the other is from his outfit of loyal scoundrels. Bounty hunting not your thing? Then try some real hunting and sign on at the big safari camp- if you're gonna be taking pot shots at the local widlife all day then you might as well be getting paid for it.

Adventurers who like employment with a guaranteed contract will want to see what they can do to help the crew members of the northern observatory tower- surely they're afraid to go outside to repair their gear because they are scientists- not seasoned explorers. Right? If playing security guard at a work site isn't your thing you then go sign up with the Balcheka corporation. They need you to pick up a few things at one of their abandoned facilities... Why can't they just do it themselves? Oh, no real reason...

boardgame.name: Letting the Days Go By
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Letting the Days Go By is a short GM-less role-playing game about being in your early twenties, and how they suck. It is also about cycles, and breaking free from them. It is also about friendships, community, and growth. It's somewhat like a poem. Tell some stories. Root yourself in nostalgia.

All you need to play is a few friends, a deck of tarot cards, and maybe some beer.

boardgame.name: Gray Zone? Run Away!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

이유 없는 이상현상들. 그리고 거기에 거듭된 희생들은 무지한 이들의 분노를 불러오기 마련입니다.

물론 무지한 것이 죄는 아니죠. 조작된 무지는 이젠 무지한 자신 그 자체를 혐오하는데 까지 영향을 미친다는 것을 높으신 분들은 잘 모르는 모양입니다.

■월 □일 자정, □도시의 전체에 계엄령이 발생했습니다.

요란한 사이렌 소리. 뭐라고 설명하기도 어려운 참혹한 거리의 광경. 조용히 고층 건물의 상층에서 자신의 할 일을 묵묵히 수행하는 이 곳은 너무나도 대조적이라서, 도저히 같은 세계라고 볼 수가 없다는 위화감이 당신들을 갉으며 시간을 흘려보냅니다.

boardgame.name: Monochrome City Light
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

■ 월 □ 일 자정, 퇴근하고 몸을 씻고 드라마 본방 사수도 완료 ...

최근에 많이 바쁜 일이 많았지 만, 오늘도 별 다를 바없는 하루가 지속되는 것이 안심했습니다. 기분 좋은 하루를 마치고 당신은 오늘도 침대에 몸을 눕히십시오.

... 집에했는데.

boardgame.name: 무채세계 활극론
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Call of Cthulhu Cyberpunk Action Scenario Collection.

User summary:

This collection gathers four previously-published scenarios:

Black Out? All Right!

At midnight on Monday, the entire city plunged into blackout. There's a big payoff if you can... solve it?


White Crack? Take Out!

On the last day of the month, at midnight, all communication throughout the city ceased. As things fall apart, the question is - can you... solve it?


Gray Zone? Run Away!

Abnormal phenomena and hideous sacrifices occur. Who... or what... is causing it?


Monochrome City Light

On the last day of the month, at midnight, I shower and plan to watch television. I've been busy lately, and it's good the day is over. But it feels like something's... not right...

boardgame.name: Black Out? All Right!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The cultists who worship the earth gods are everywhere. Most of them were ordinary people at first. But, they got tired of looking down when the cops walked by. They thought it would be better to listen to the sorcerer - to become a faithful servant of the gods, rather than always submit.

boardgame.name: White Crack? Take Out!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The cults created a virtual AI wizard, and dedicated it to their god. But if you make the thing, can you control it? And if it's intelligent, will choose to serve the god?

boardgame.name: Monopolization
boardgame.description: Players start with a company and are placed in a random city. They have a limited time before retirement to increase their share portfolio which will add to their score. The player can move clockwise around the city conducting different actions as well as travel to different cities. With these actions the player can attempt to gain capital for their company in order to purchase shares of their own and others' companies. The main method of gaining capital is to have other players and NPC consumers utilize the player's properties either by landing on them or purchasing the good or service they provide. Players can set prices to utilize their property which can create price wars. Legislation at the capitol building can also be changed to limit prices set for specific industries.

boardgame.name: KangaZoo
boardgame.description: Adventure
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 AGD Awards Best Serious Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Ballistic Baseball
boardgame.description: Can you hit more home runs than your opponent?
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 AGD Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Crossy Road Castle
boardgame.description: Bring your friends and see how far you can get in this endless spinning tower of arcade fun! Keep climbing as high as you can. Every run is different!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 AGD Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2021 AGD Awards Best Ongoing Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Piffle
boardgame.description: Cartoon

boardgame.name: Elden: Path of the Forgotten
boardgame.description: Elden: Path of the Forgotten is a medieval RPG with roots in eldritch horror. Elden explores storytelling through non-traditional, indirect methods — like reading an illustrated book in a language you don't understand.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 AGD Awards Best Emerging Game Nominee

boardgame.name: If Found...
boardgame.description: If Found… is a game about searching for connection.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee
2021 D.I.C.E. Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Pokémon Café Mix
boardgame.description: Puzzle
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Hyperdot

boardgame.name: Guadalcanal: Supply and combat
ガダルカナル～補給と戦闘
boardgame.description:
In August 1942, the US Marine Corps suddenly landed on Guadalcanal Island in the Solomon Islands. The success or failure of supply by sea transportation was crucial.

For the first time in history, this game recreates Guadalcanal's land and water battles on the same map!
Both games can be played individually or can also be linked. In the land-sea game combined play, the naval battle determines the amount of supplies arriving on Guadalcanal and also the success or failure of land artillery. Artillery greatly influences the land battlefield.

Number of counters:

land: about 50 units + 50 markers
sea: 120


Map: 1 full size
Game period:

land: September-November 1942 (7 turns)
sea: 1 turn 5 minutes (6 to 16 turns


Unit size: 1 unit 1 battalion / 1 unit 1 ship
Map area: North coast of Guadalcanal Island and near the north
Play time: About 1 to 2 hours
Number of players: 2 people
Play time: 1-3 hours (depending on the scenario)

adapted from publisher's website

boardgame.name: SS Armored Division Commander: German Armored Division Commander 2, Western Front
ＳＳ装甲師団長～ドイツ装甲師団長２・西部戦線編
boardgame.description:
This is the second release of the popular "German Armored Division Commander" series.

The stage this time is the Western Front. The player is a SS Armored Division Commander and battles on the Western Front in 1944.
Can you lead the SS Armored Division and use the more powerful Tiger tanks to stop the overwhelming Allied invasion ?

In this series, there are four types of units: tanks, self-propelled artillery, infantry, and artillery. The appropriate tactics differ depending on when you can shoot.
In particular, the difference in flexibility between the rotating turret tanks and self-propelled artillery with a fixed barrel is simulated.
The battlefield will be greatly influenced by the timing and effect of its appearance.
The series "German Armored Division Commander" rules have been modified. For instance, the range of the anti-tank gun is 2 and effectiveness is increased. The operation plan is improved by distinguishing movement and deployment mode. The rating of weapons and the open top tanks are revised

Number of counters: 252 pieces
Map: 1 full size
Game period: 1-2 days (16 turns)
Unit size: 1 unit - 1 platoon-company
Game range: Operation area of ​​one armored division
Play time: About 5-8 hours
Number of players: 2 people

boardgame.name: The Cuboids' Proud Christmas
boardgame.description:
15 year old Dylan Cuboid was about to decorate the Christmas tree.
It was his turn this year and he had decided to make it something extra special for this year! His two older siblings, „the Twins" Brenda and Brandon, have had their "coming out" this year. Duh... Literally everybody knew about it, but these two needed there special piece of pie of course... :D So Dylan decided to decorate the Christmas tree in rainbow colors from top to bottom to celebrate with them once more in pride!
But there was an obstacle.
You know, the Cuboid family, they have a tradition. Whoever took down the decorations last year has to decorate the tree this year. That's how he had gotten his assignment. But back then he had not been the forward thinking and well organized Dylan of today. He was a kid, who wanted to get things over with to play with the toys he had been gifted. And so the boxes were not cleanly sorted like he would have liked them to be now...
So he needs a little help!

The gameplay consists of dice manipulation by using the powers of said dice. The tree decorating part is RnR

The Cuboids' Proud Christmas was an entry to the 10th Anniversary Christmas PnP contest. It's WIP-Thread can be found here:
[WIP] The Cuboids' Proud Christmas - 10th anniversary Christmas Print and Play Game contest!

boardgame.name: Daiku9
boardgame.description: Daiku9 is a two player abstract game. The board has nine areas of 3x3 fields each. Players take turn adding pieces to these fields, first their own, than their opponent's, then their own again. Afterwards, they move by jumping over other pieces, trying to get their 27 pieces to fill three areas completely. The first player to achieve this wins.

boardgame.name: Xángano
boardgame.description:
Two players try to move their four pieces over a board to the opposite corner. The pieces may not lose contact with each other; there are various difficulty levels, in some of them they need to stay in touch in numerical order as well (they are numbered 1-4).
A die determines the number of pieces that can be played on the turn of a player.

boardgame.name: Card Rails
boardgame.description:
Card Rails is a 3-5 player, 20-30 minute cube rails game played on a deck of cards. Instead of giving you a predesignated map, players together create the landscape of the game they are playing, blocking others and bettering their own positions, all while making the tough decision to keep a card for future financial gain or to garner an immediate reward.

Throughout the game, players discard cards in hand to perform actions: Take a Share or Build Track. If building track, the discarded card can be used to add onto and expand the map. Players want to build into various hexes to increase their companies' values or swap out cards from their hand.

At the end of the game, cards remaining in hand count as shares of a company, along with shares taken during the game. The player who has the most shares in the most valuable companies wins!

Part of Kickstarter's Make 100 Campaign, the physical copy of this game was limited to 100 copies. Print & Play is also available.

boardgame.description: A funny word game where the fastest kid wins! The game consists of a timer which stops showing two letters. The kids need to find a word now containing both of the letters. The fastest kid wins and starts the timer again for the next round.

boardgame.name: Twingo
boardgame.description:
Twingo is a strategic game for 2 players where each player tries to reach the starting position of the other player.

The pieces in this game are cubes with differently colored sides. When moving your piece, you roll it on one of its other sides. After moving, it has to have a different color then your other piece. If your cube shows the same color as one of the pieces of your opponent, your opponent has to move that piece.

boardgame.name: Wortmeister

boardgame.name: Verflixter Turm

boardgame.name: Gleich & Gleich gesellt sich gern

All players play at the same time and discard their cards while looking at the same time for the second part of the pair which shows the same feature.

boardgame.name: Gravelotte 1870
boardgame.description:
Gravelotte 1870 covers the decisive battle of Gravelotte/St Privat on the 18th of August 1870 in the early stages of the Franco-Prussian War. Each player plays either the French or the Prussian in an epic battle to surround the city of Metz.

The gameplay is simple: players have their own deck of 6 cards and plan for a sequence of action each turn that will be resolved simultaneously. To support their actions they both have access to Asset cards, specific to each faction that can be triggered if the timing is right.

The design is based on the Japanese game Houten 1905, and implements some new mechanics to expand on it. It is a fast paced (5 to 15 minutes), historical bluffing game for everyone.

boardgame.name: Infinity N4: Core Rules
boardgame.description:
Infinity N4 is a 28 mm metal miniatures game simulating special operations and skirmishes in a high technology sci-fi universe. an exciting and action-packed near-future where secret missions, black ops, and covert actions determine the destiny of the Humankind.

Infinity N4 recreates direct action operations, which are quick, lethal, and very risky. The player assumes command of a small group of elite troopers engaging in undercover and clandestine operations.

Infinity N4 is an innovative game system, dynamic and entertaining, which allows all players to participate during the entire gaming sequence. It possesses a great amount of realism and flexibility, providing players with a wide variety of tactical and strategic maneuvers to employ during the game.

Infinity N4 Contains two full-color books in a slipcase. With improved and streamlined rules, new troops, more background to set the scene, and introducing O-12 and its Sectorial Army, Starmada, Infinity N4 goes one step beyond!

boardgame.name: Plebby Quest: The Crusades
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the chaotic world
Plebby Quest: The Crusades is a turn-based strategy game set during the crusades of Europe and the Middle East. You must survive between ambitious rulers dreaming of building an empire, treacherous neighbours that long to burn your kingdom, and the religion which always makes unreasonable demands. Survive and build your kingdom’s legacy to last centuries

Hard, Yet Tender
After drawing hard and straight outlines, we drew unique faces for our characters. Then we had them stand in front of solid color tone backgrounds and brought them to life with our in-house software. Behold! They laugh, rage, and tells us their stories with their chewy and tender movements.

Two Game Modes
In Scenario mode you will follow a character’s story, while in Sandbox mode you can conquer the world without any restriction. Each mode is connected and will affect the other. Good choices and decisions from past games will lead your future plays to success.

Friend or Enemy?
Neighbouring kingdoms remembers your behaviour and will react to it. Critical mistakes bring dissent and lead to war. If you react according to a character’s personality, they will open their mind.

Accusation
In the 11th century, persons without faith were either barbarians beyond the borders, or heretics that were burned at stake. Every kingdom is under the influence of a religion, and will demand your kingdom prove their faith

Conspiracy & Backroom Deals
Every June, a meeting is held during which believers of each faith gather to condemn and denounce the others. Kingdoms will condemn one another, while religious leaders will stop a war or demand a crusade. You must do anything possible to turn the participants’ opinion to your liking, including bribes, threats, and all kinds of dirty tricks. All will be forgiven in the name of God.

Easy Choices and Terrible Costs
There are many choices before you start a war. However, once a war begins, everything will come down to either one of two choices: Will you burn them? Or will you be burnt?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Great Cities: Washington, DC
boardgame.description:
Great Cities: Washington, DC allows two to four players the ability to explore 150 years of history, culture, political intrigue and urban development in our nation's capital.

The game begins in 1871 and is played over eight 20-year generations (ending in 2030). Each generation, players receive income and draft development cards. Then players building housing for increased population, pay and play development and culture cards, and otherwise build out the city.

After eight generations, players score their buildings, cards and secret agenda cards to determine a winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Kolonne on Tour
boardgame.description:
Each player has 3 trucks and wants to transport material (card board chips) to construction sites. Movement is on a board with a street net by one chosen die out of 5. Next player must choose out of 4 dice and so on. A construction site will be scored if all necessary materials are brought or even earlier, if the lead for the majority is unchangeable. First and second player get points.

This was produced and published as a commercial game by Günter Rux GmbH which produces scaffoldings.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Prosperity
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Prosperity is a game about growing a city through strategic resource management.A Text Based City Builder
Most of the time when somebody says City Builder, people think about city planning - where to place buildings, how to get around terrain, etc. Prosperity takes that away and instead provides challenges in thinking about how to balance growth and sustainability. A text based approach reduces complexity in considering how buildings are placed, where people work/live, and what terrain modifications are necessary. All a player needs to know is how much usable land there is remaining, and how to go about getting more land.
Not all city building elements are abstracted however; players must order building construction, and other projects to meet demands placed by people and natural events.

It is a Simulation
One particular philosophy the game tries to stick with is the concept of emergent gameplay through expressing individual systems of interaction rather than directly dictating mechanics. For example, suppose we want a way to model resource growth. A simple method is to have clear numerical values for resource/second based on some combination of factors. Prosperity took a more complex route: resources are created when it is harvested, refined, by some group of workers. Each worker contributes some amount of work, which is derived from some independent variables. A piece of work produces some resource once it is done. This means the mechanism of resource growth and predicting resource growth is itself emergent from more fundamental rules. This piece of logic is complex but it opens up the game to a number of new possibilities - for example having some way to affect production output by making people happier, or considering trade-offs between the happiness of one group of workers with the happiness of another group. We could now model complexity or effort required to do some work based on variables like seasonal changes, migration patterns, maybe even availability of water. When gameplay is emergent from some set of rules that expresses a simulation of a world, the gameplay itself can be wildly different time after time.

It is a Story
Stories drive people to try new things, give hints to explore a mechanic and think deeper about how to use it. Due to the way the system was designed, outcomes can be very different, so while it is a good idea to have some fixed storypoints, the game works better where stories themselves are fluid. Therefore, the game isn't telling the players a story, so much as players are writing their own stories through their choices.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: World War 1 Wargames Rules
boardgame.description:
Tabletop minatures wargames rules.

Scales:
1mm : 1 yard
1 turn : 1 minute

Variable figure scales according to size of figures/vehicles used:
6mm figures : 1 figure = 1 man
15mm figures : 1 figure = 10 man
25mm figures : 1 figure = 25 man

Units of 100 men/50 cavalry/4-6 vehicles or guns

Overall battle scale is approximately brigade (multiple battalions)

boardgame.name: Just Geomorphs #39
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility. This set contains:

Player and GM versions of two 100x200 foot geomorph tiles.
Player and GM versions of two 200x200 foot geomorph tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing both versions of the player's map.
A short readme PDF.

boardgame.name: Night City Storys
boardgame.description:
From the introductory comment in the book:

"Contained within these covers you will find either three or four stories. Sinc these adventures were designed as a series, Sweet Revenge has been split into two parts for the sake of realism... Night City Stories (sic) is being published for many reasons: ..."

boardgame.name: USA Alive
boardgame.description: Newspaper prop for, and advertising, 'Underground', modelled to look vaguely like actual newspaper 'USA Today'

boardgame.name: Isabel y Diego
boardgame.description:
The legend of the lovers of Teruel has multiple literary and theatrical versions, as well as a reflection in other artistic manifestations. It is a story about an impossible and chaste love with a tragic ending, possibly originating in the 15th century but whose plot is set in the 13th century, starring the lady Isabel de Segura and the gentleman Juan Martínez de Marcilla (better known as Diego from the theatrical performances of the seventeenth century). Today it is an unavoidable part of the culture of Teruel.

With Isabel y Diego, will you be able to change the legend?
In this game 3 to 7 players are divided into two teams.
The first team will be friends of Isabel and Diego who want to change the disastrous ending of the legend and get the couple to reunite and grow old together. To do this, they will help Diego to achieve the necessary wealth to marry her to Isabel, and will prevent her from giving in to the pressure she receives from her to marry Don Rodrigo de Azagra.
The other team will be enemies of the couple who will try by all means that Diego falls in combat and that Isabel collapses and agrees to marry the Lord of Albarracín.

Isabel y Diego is a strategy game in which you have to coordinate with your team to achieve your objectives while trying to disrupt those of the opponents.
Play cunning, decide wisely how to use the cards in your hands, and lead your team to victory.

boardgame.name: Character Pack 4: Hired Hands & Helping Henchmen – A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
boardgame.description:
Character Pack 4 for Five Leagues deviates a bit from the standard by offering a new game mechanic: Hired hands.

With these rules you can hire on helpers such as a blacksmith, torchbearer or 6 other types. Their purpose is to assist your war band off the field (and occasionally on it), allowing you to form a support staff.

You can even attempt to push them into battle in an emergency, but they're likely to demand more pay or even leave on the spot.

This pack can be added to any campaign, even if using alternate warbands such as the Dwarf warband. It can be added to an on-going campaign with no issue.

boardgame.name: CHOAM
boardgame.description:
A free PnP asymmetrical Monopoly game inspired by the classic Dune board game.

Unlike traditional Monopoly, players can choose between five different factions, each with unique abilities and win conditions. Each player will have four fighters they can use to attack others and lay claim to the enemy's strongholds but it will always be at a cost.

Players should also be careful of the very planet itself, as Arrakis is a harsh place and to survive it will take its toll. Luckily, if a player owns certain territories they either gain by force or are naturally given it from the start, they can receive riches in the form of the spice melange.

With the spice, players can bribe and trade with each other and afford to survive in the hostile deserts of Arrakis. But players should be cautious, as deals can be broken and players can lie their way to getting spice. Calling them out on not following through on a deal or catching them in a lie can cause them to lose a turn but a player falsely accusing someone of lying can have harsher consequences.

The game ends when any of the unique faction specific winning conditions are met.

boardgame.description:
Six cards for Villagers:

Hayer, Lumberjack, Miner, Vasel, Healey, Garcia.

Originally available during the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter Campaign as part of the Builders Pack.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Potions & Talismans
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Every hero relies on a few extra resources to get through a day of dangerous adventuring: a restorative potion, special arrows, an extra scroll, or the perfect talisman. The Pathfinder Potions and Talismans Deck contains 110 cards detailing every consumable magic item in the Pathfinder Core Rulebook, including ammunition, oils, potions, scrolls, talismans, and more! Each card features statistics, descriptions, and beautiful full-color illustrations. Whether you're a GM building a merchant's wares or a player stocking up for your next adventure, the Potions and Talismans Deck keeps your must-have items at hand!

boardgame.name: The Ruined Sanctuary of Altrius
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago Aspen and the surrounding region was inhabited by a tribe known as the Sundevils. For centuries the tribe ruled the land until the Civulian military port of Grohm attacked the tribes, pushing them back into the mountains. The battle known as Hawke Man’s Massacre was the bloodiest battle fought on these grounds. Many Civulians fell in it’s wake, and the Sundevil Tribe was completely vanquished.

The Sundevils were driven back into their holy temple known as Altrius Sanctuary, where the final battle took place. The battle waged on for days and nights, as the winged fighters were time and time again resurrected by their priests. Eventually the Grohm warriors slayed the priests and cast their remains into the depths of the Altrius Sanctuary and sealed the site away for good.

Centuries have passed since, and the tribe has now been awakened from within the depths of the Sanctuary…

boardgame.name: High Frontier
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whatever happened to that beautiful future of jet packs and moon bases? Of electric highways and push-button cooking? That future of crew-cut engineers and rugged astronauts that seemed so certain circa 1949?

You hold it in your hands!

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Garden Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Natural light flickers in the distance towards the end of the winding stone tunnel where a wall has collapsed. The main door has been barred by the fallen debris but the collapsed wall luckily gives access to a ledge and balcony built into the cliff.

After turning a corner you find yourself in a large room that has partially collapsed, full of plant life. The floor is lined by large metal grates and below them a stream of water flows out towards the cliff. At the far end of the room there is a large bloom that has just bloomed with a vibrant red flower and an intact crescent basin of sorts, full of pristine life giving water sits just behind it.

boardgame.name: Plant Symbionts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Let Your Power Grow!

Exobiology and biotechnology combine into an awesome array of new options for your Starfinder Roleplaying Game campaign in Plant Symbionts! Tap into the power of the alien verdant green with over a dozen new class features, spells, and feats, as well as the symbiont master archetype. Infuse your equipment with root and vine, and bond a personal symbiont to your character to grant them new abilities, including simple symbiont companions and a dozen fully described symbiont creatures from airsuits and flight packs to grappling claws and living armor, which can be used as standalone creatures or bonded to provide special abilities to their hosts.
